verses.verse: I am the man<WH1397> that has seen<WH7200> affliction<WH6040> by the rod<WH7626> of his wrath<WH5678>.
He has led<WH5090> me<WH3212>, and brought me into darkness<WH2822>, but not into light<WH216>.
Surely against me is he turned<WH7725>; he turns<WH2015> his hand<WH3027> against me all the day<WH3117>.
My flesh<WH1320> and my skin<WH5785> has he made old<WH1086>; he has broken<WH7665> my bones<WH6106>.
He has built against<WH1129> me<WH5362>, and surrounded me with gall<WH7219> and hardship<WH8513>.
He has set<WH3427> me in dark places<WH4285>, as they that be dead<WH4191> of old<WH5769>.
He has hedged<WH1443> me about<WH3318>, that I cannot get out: he has made my chain<WH5178> heavy<WH3513>.
Also when I cry<WH2199> and shout<WH7768>, he shuts out<WH5640> my prayer<WH8605>.
He has enclosed<WH1443> my ways<WH1870> with cut stone<WH1496>, he has made my paths<WH5410> crooked<WH5753>.
He was unto me as a bear<WH1677> lying in wait<WH693>, and as a lion<WH738> in secret places<WH4565>.
He has turned aside<WH5493> my ways<WH1870>, and pulled me in pieces<WH6582>: he has made<WH7760> me desolate<WH8074>.
He has bent<WH1869> his bow<WH7198>, and set<WH5324> me as a mark<WH4307> for the arrow<WH2671>.
He has caused the arrows<WH1121> of his quiver<WH827> to enter<WH935> into my mind<WH3629>.
I was a derision<WH7814> to all my people<WH5971>; and their song<WH5058> all the day<WH3117>.
He has filled<WH7646> me with bitterness<WH4844>, he has made me full<WH7301> of wormwood<WH3939>.
He has also broken<WH1638> my teeth<WH8127> with gravel stones<WH2687>, he has covered<WH3728> me with ashes<WH665>.
And you have removed<WH2186> my soul<WH5315> far off<WH2186> from peace<WH7965>: I forgot<WH5382> prosperity<WH2896>.
And I said<WH559>, My strength<WH5331> and my hope<WH8431> is perished<WH6> from the Lord<WH3068>:
Remembering<WH2142> my affliction<WH6040> and my misery<WH4788>, the wormwood<WH3939> and the gall<WH7219>.
My soul<WH5315> has them still<WH2142> in memory<WH2142>, and is humbled in me<WH7743>.
This I recall<WH7725> to my mind<WH3820>, therefore have I hope<WH3176>.
It is of the Lord<WH3068>'s mercies<WH2617> that we are not consumed<WH8552>, because his compassions<WH7356> fail not<WH3615>.
They are new<WH2319> every morning<WH1242>: great<WH7227> is your faithfulness<WH530>.
The Lord<WH3068> is my portion<WH2506>, says<WH559> my soul<WH5315>; therefore will I hope in him<WH3176>.
The Lord<WH3068> is good<WH2896> unto them that wait<WH6960> for him<WH5315>, to the soul that seeks him<WH1875>.
It is good<WH2896> that a man should both hope<WH3175> and quietly wait<WH1748> for the salvation<WH8668> of the Lord<WH3068>.
It is good<WH2896> for a man<WH1397> that he bear<WH5375> the yoke<WH5923> in his youth<WH5271>.
He sits<WH3427> alone<WH910> and keeps silence<WH1826>, because he has borne it upon him<WH5190>.
He puts<WH5414> his mouth<WH6310> in the dust<WH6083>; if so be there may be<WH3426> hope<WH8615>.
He gives<WH5414> his cheek<WH3895> to him that strikes<WH5221> him<WH7646>: he is filled full with reproach<WH2781>.
For the Lord<WH136> will not cast off<WH2186> for ever<WH5769>:
But though he cause grief<WH3013>, yet will he have compassion<WH7355> according to the multitude<WH7230> of his mercies<WH2617>.
For he does not afflict<WH6031> willingly<WH3820> nor grieve<WH3013> the sons<WH1121> of men<WH376>.
To crush<WH1792> under his feet<WH7272> all the prisoners<WH615> of the earth<WH776>,
To turn aside<WH5186> the right<WH4941> of a man<WH1397> before the face<WH6440> of the most High<WH5945>,
To subvert<WH5791> a man<WH120> in his cause<WH7379>, the Lord<WH136> approves not<WH7200>.
Who is he that says<WH559>, and it comes to pass<WH136>, when the Lord commanded it not<WH6680>?
Out of the mouth<WH6310> of the most High<WH5945> proceeds<WH3318> not evil<WH7451> and good<WH2896>?
Therefore does a living<WH2416> man<WH120> complain<WH596>, a man<WH1397> for the punishment of his sins<WH2399>?
Let us search<WH2664> and try<WH2713> our ways<WH1870>, and turn again<WH7725> to the Lord<WH3068>.
Let us lift up<WH5375> our heart<WH3824> with our hands<WH3709> unto God<WH410> in the heavens<WH8064>.
We<WH5168> have transgressed<WH6586> and have rebelled<WH4784>: you have not pardoned<WH5545>.
You have covered<WH5526> with anger<WH639>, and persecuted<WH7291> us<WH2026>: you have slain, you have not pitied<WH2550>.
You have covered<WH5526> yourself with a cloud<WH6051>, that our prayer<WH8605> should not pass through<WH5674>.
You have made<WH7760> us as the offscouring<WH5501> and refuse<WH3973> in the midst<WH7130> of the people<WH5971>.
All our enemies<WH341> have opened<WH6475> their mouths against us<WH6310>.
Fear<WH6343> and a snare<WH6354> is come upon us<WH7612>, desolation and destruction<WH7667>.
My eye<WH5869> runs down<WH3381> with rivers<WH6388> of water<WH4325> for the destruction<WH7667> of the daughter<WH1323> of my people<WH5971>.
My eye<WH5869> trickles down<WH5064>, and ceases<WH1820> not<WH2014>, without any intermission,
Until the Lord<WH3068> look down<WH8259>, and behold<WH7200> from heaven<WH8064>.
My eye<WH5869> affects<WH5953> my heart<WH5315> because of all the daughters<WH1323> of my city<WH5892>.
My enemies<WH341> chased<WH6679> me severely<WH6679>, like a bird<WH6833>, without cause<WH2600>.
They have cut off<WH6789> my life<WH2416> in the dungeon<WH953>, and cast<WH3034> a stone upon me<WH68>.
Waters<WH4325> flowed over<WH6687> my head<WH7218>; then I said<WH559>, I am cut off<WH1504>.
I called<WH7121> upon your name<WH8034>, O Lord<WH3068>, out of the low<WH8482> dungeon<WH953>.
You have heard<WH8085> my voice<WH6963>: hide<WH5956> not your ear<WH241> at my breathing<WH7309>, at my cry<WH7775>.
You drew near<WH7126> in the day<WH3117> that I called<WH7121> upon you<WH559>: you said, Fear not<WH3372>.
O Lord<WH136>, you have pleaded<WH7378> the causes<WH7379> of my soul<WH5315>; you have redeemed<WH1350> my life<WH2416>.
O Lord<WH3068>, you have seen<WH7200> my wrong<WH5792>: judge<WH8199> my cause<WH4941>.
You have seen<WH7200> all their vengeance<WH5360> and all their imaginations against me<WH4284>.
You have heard<WH8085> their reproach<WH2781>, O Lord<WH3068>, and all their imaginations against me<WH4284>;
The lips<WH8193> of those that rose up<WH6965> against me<WH1902>, and their device against me all the day<WH3117>.
Behold<WH5027> their sitting down<WH3427>, and their rising up<WH7012>; I am their music<WH4485>.
Render<WH7725> unto them a recompense<WH1576>, O Lord<WH3068>, according to the work<WH4639> of their hands<WH3027>.
Give<WH5414> them sorrow<WH4044> of heart<WH3820>, your curse unto them<WH8381>.
Persecute<WH7291> and destroy<WH8045> them in anger<WH639> from under the heavens<WH8064> of the Lord<WH3068>.
